flexboxGrow.description: Content area grows to fill space and scrolls independently (RECOMMENDED for app layouts)
whenToUse: When only content area should scroll, not header
flexboxGrow.example:
Header
Content scrolls
flexboxGrow.logic: Container is full height (h-screen). Header doesn't shrink (flex-shrink-0). Content grows (flex-1) and scrolls independently (overflow-y-auto). Only content area scrolls.

stickyHeader.description: Header sticks to top when scrolling reaches it
whenToUse: Long pages where header should appear after scrolling
When you want header to scroll with page initially, then stick
stickyHeader.example: <header class="sticky top-0 z-50 bg-brand-bg-white border-b border-brand-stroke-weak">Header</header><main>Content scrolls normally</main>
stickyHeader.logic: Header scrolls with page initially, then sticks at top when scrolling reaches it. Full page scrolls together.

fixedHeader.description: Header always fixed at top of viewport
whenToUse: Navigation bars that must always be visible
Simple layouts where header should never scroll away
When header height is known and consistent
fixedHeader.example: <header class="fixed top-0 left-0 right-0 z-50 bg-brand-bg-white">Header</header><main class="pt-[header-height] h-screen overflow-y-auto">Content with padding-top</main>
fixedHeader.logic: Header is always visible. Content needs padding-top equal to header height. Full page scrolls.

pageWithHeaderContentScrollable.description: Page with header fixed, only content area scrolls (Flexbox Grow Method)
pageWithHeaderContentScrollable.scrollBehavior: Only main content scrolls, header stays fixed
pageWithHeaderContentScrollable.htmlExample: Header Content
whenToUse: When header must always be visible
When you want only content to scroll
pageWithHeaderContentScrollable.importantNotes: This is the RECOMMENDED method for app-like interfaces. Header stays fixed, only content scrolls.

pageWithHeader.description: Simple page with header, full page scrolls
pageWithHeader.htmlExample: Header Content
whenToUse: Content pages where header can scroll away
When you want natural page scrolling

whenToUseContainer.description: Use container class when content should be centered with max-width
examples: Main content: container mx-auto px-4 py-8

whenNotToUseContainer.description: Don't use container for full-width elements
examples: Header: No container, use px-4 or px-6 for padding
Full-width background: No container, let it span full width

whenToUseGrid.description: Use CSS Grid for 2D layouts (rows and columns)
whenToUse: When you need both row and column control
examples: Card grid: grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3 gap-6

whenToUseFlexbox.description: Use Flexbox for 1D layouts (row or column)

padding.description: Use padding for internal spacing within an element

margin.description: Use margin for external spacing between elements
whenToUse: Space between buttons in a group

gap.description: Use gap with flexbox or grid (RECOMMENDED)

workflow: 1. Read layout-guide.json to understand layout patterns
2. Read theme-guide.json for color and component styling
3. Determine page type based on requirements
4. Use appropriate layout method (flexbox grow, sticky, fixed)
5. Apply container rules (when to use, when not to use)
6. Choose grid vs flexbox based on layout needs
7. Follow spacing rules (padding vs margin, gap vs space)
8. Combine with theme utility classes from theme-guide.json

pageTypeSelection.rule: ALWAYS determine page type first before creating layout
options: pageWithHeaderContentScrollable - Header fixed, content scrolls (RECOMMENDED for apps)
pageTypeSelection.decisionTree: Ask: Does header need to stay visible? → Yes: Use flexbox grow. Is it a simple page? → Yes: Use simple header layout.

containerUsage.rule: NEVER use container on full-width elements (headers, sidebars, backgrounds)
containerUsage.rule2: ALWAYS use container mx-auto px-4 for main content areas

wrong: Header with container (header should be full-width)
Sidebar with container (sidebar should be full-width)
correct: Header: No container, use px-4 for padding
Main content: container mx-auto px-4 py-8

gridVsFlexbox.rule: Use Grid for 2D layouts (rows AND columns), Flexbox for 1D layouts (row OR column)
gridVsFlexbox.decisionTree: Need both row and column control? → Grid. Need horizontal or vertical alignment? → Flexbox.

rules: CRITICAL: Determine page type FIRST (pageWithHeader, pageWithHeaderContentScrollable, etc.)
CRITICAL: For app-like interfaces, use flexbox grow method (h-screen flex flex-col)
CRITICAL: Never use container on full-width elements (headers, sidebars)
CRITICAL: Always use container mx-auto px-4 for main content areas
Use Grid for 2D layouts (card grids, dashboards)
Use Flexbox for 1D layouts (navigation, vertical stacks, alignment)
Use gap with flexbox/grid (preferred over space-x/space-y)
Use padding for internal spacing, margin for external spacing
Scrollable content areas: Use bg-brand-bg-fill for background
Always combine layout classes with theme utility classes from theme-guide.json
